Headline: Updated: No Trains Between Forest Park and Harlem (Forest Park Branch)
ShortDescription: Blue Line service partially resumed, remains suspended between Forest Park & Harlem (Forest Park Branch) due to track conditions.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Service on the Blue Line has partially resumed, but remains suspended between the Forest Park and Harlem (Forest Park Branch) due to track conditions.

As a result, trains are operating as follows:

  • between O'Hare and Harlem (Forest Park Branch).

Shuttle buses are available between Harlem (Forest Park Branch) and Forest Park to provide connecting service.

See station personnel for further assistance, and pay attention to announcements on trains and at stations for service information.

We are working to restore service as quickly as possible. Allow extra travel time.

Headline: Red Line Service Running with Delays
ShortDescription: Red Line trains are running with significant delays and congestion near Cermak due to signal problems.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Red Line trains are running with significant delays and congestion near Cermak due to signal problems.

At this time, also consider other service alternatives that may serve your trip, such as nearby bus routes, or using buses to other rail lines.

Personnel are working to restore normal service. Allow extra travel time.

Headline: O'Hare-bound Blue Line Service Delayed at UIC/Halsted
ShortDescription: O'Hare-bound Blue Line trains are standing at UIC/Halsted due to a sick customer. Crews working to restore service.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
O'Hare-bound Blue Line trains are standing at UIC/Halsted due to a sick customer.

Personnel are working to restore service. Allow extra travel time.
